course.description_en: Discover your amazing body and learn about all its special parts. Find out what each part does to help you every day.
course.description_ar: اكتشف جسمك المذهل وتعلم عن جميع أجزائه الخاصة. اكتشف ما يفعله كل جزء لمساعدتك كل يوم.
course.subject: science

content_data.title: All About My Head
content_data.content: Look in the mirror! Do you see your head? Your head is at the top. Your head is very important. Your head holds your brain. Your brain helps you think. Your brain helps you remember. On your head, you have hair. Hair can be long or short. Hair can be curly or straight. Hair keeps your head warm. Touch your head gently. Feel your hair. Your head is round like a ball. Your head moves up and down. Your head moves left and right. Your head is amazing! Take care of your special head.
learning_objectives: Identify the head on their body
Understand the head contains the brain
Learn about hair and its purpose

vocabulary_words.definition: Top part of your body that holds your brain
Special part inside your head that helps you think
Soft strands that grow on your head
Use your brain to learn and remember
Keep things in your brain to think about later

materials_needed: Mirror (large enough for child to see head)
content_data.parent_guidance: Let child look in mirror and touch their own head gently. Show them their hair and talk about its texture. Demonstrate head movements safely. Explain that the brain is inside and helps them think.
safety_notes: Always be gentle when touching head
discussion_questions: What is inside your head?
What does your hair feel like?
Can you move your head up and down?

extension_activities.title: Head Movement Dance
extension_activities.description: Gently move head up, down, left, right to music.

extension_activities.title: Hair Texture Exploration
extension_activities.description: Feel different textures and compare to hair (soft brush, cotton).

content_data.title: Amazing Eyes That Help Me See
content_data.content: Look at your eyes! You have TWO eyes. Your eyes help you see. Your eyes help you see colors. Red, blue, yellow, green! Your eyes help you see shapes. Circle, square, triangle! Your eyes help you see big things. Your eyes help you see small things. Blink your eyes. Close your eyes. Open your eyes. When you close your eyes, you cannot see. When you open your eyes, you can see everything! Your eyes are amazing tools. Let's play with our eyes!

vocabulary_words.definition: Two special parts that help you see everything
Look at things with your eyes
Close and open your eyes quickly
Red, blue, yellow, green and more
Circle, square, triangle forms

materials_needed: Soft cloth for gentle eye area
content_data.parent_guidance: Show child their eyes in mirror. Point out colors and shapes around room. Practice gentle blinking together. Never touch eyes directly. Demonstrate looking at near and far objects.
safety_notes: Keep objects away from eye area
Use only soft materials near face
No bright lights directly in eyes
discussion_questions: How many eyes do you have?
What color is this toy?
What happens when you close your eyes?

extension_activities.title: Color Hunt
extension_activities.description: Use eyes to find different colored objects around the room.

extension_activities.title: Big and Small Game
extension_activities.description: Look for big objects and small objects with your eyes.

content_data.title: My Special Nose
content_data.content: Touch your nose gently. Everyone has ONE nose. Your nose is in the middle of your face. Your nose helps you smell. Your nose helps you breathe. Breathe in through your nose. Breathe out through your nose. Your nose can smell flowers. Your nose can smell food cooking. Your nose can smell soap when you wash hands. Some smells are nice. Some smells tell us to be careful. Your nose has two holes. Air goes in and out. Your nose is always working to help you. Thank you, nose!
learning_objectives: Identify their nose and its location
Understand nose helps smell and breathe

vocabulary_words.definition: Part in middle of face that smells and breathes
Use your nose to know how things are
Take air in and out through your nose
Pretty plants that smell nice
Right in the center

materials_needed: Safe items with pleasant scents (soap, flowers, vanilla)
content_data.parent_guidance: Let child touch their nose gently. Practice slow, calm breathing together. Show safe items to smell from distance. Never put anything directly in nose. Demonstrate breathing in and out.
safety_notes: Keep scented items at safe distance
discussion_questions: Where is your nose?
What can your nose do?
What smells do you like?

extension_activities.title: Breathing Exercise
extension_activities.description: Practice slow breathing in and out through nose.

extension_activities.title: Safe Smell Test
extension_activities.description: Smell pleasant items like soap or flowers from safe distance.

content_data.title: My Mouth Does Many Things
content_data.content: Open your mouth wide! Your mouth is amazing. Your mouth helps you eat food. Your mouth helps you drink water. Your mouth helps you talk. Your mouth helps you sing songs. Inside your mouth are your teeth. Teeth help you chew food. Teeth help you bite apples. Show your teeth in a big smile! Your tongue is inside your mouth too. Your tongue helps you taste food. Sweet, salty, yummy! Let's practice with our mouth. Say 'Hello!' Sing 'La la la!' Smile big! Your mouth is wonderful!

vocabulary_words.definition: Opening in your face for eating and talking
White, hard parts that help you chew
Soft part inside mouth that tastes
Use teeth to break up food
Use tongue to know how food is
Happy look with your mouth

content_data.parent_guidance: Show child their mouth in mirror. Demonstrate gentle teeth brushing motions. Practice making different sounds and expressions. Talk about healthy foods for teeth. Keep activities fun and positive.
safety_notes: No objects go deep in mouth
Use soft-bristled toothbrush only for demonstration
discussion_questions: What does your mouth help you do?
How many teeth can you see?
What does your tongue help with?

extension_activities.title: Happy Mouth Sounds
extension_activities.description: Make different sounds: singing, laughing, saying words.

extension_activities.title: Healthy Food for Teeth
extension_activities.description: Look at pictures of foods that are good for teeth.

lessons.title_en: My Hands Can Do So Much

content_data.title: Amazing Hands and Fingers
content_data.content: Look at your hands! You have TWO hands. Each hand has FIVE fingers. Count them: one, two, three, four, five! Your hands can do many things. Your hands can clap. Clap clap clap! Your hands can wave hello. Wave hello! Your hands can pick up toys. Your hands can hug teddy bears. Your hands can help you eat. Your hands can help you play. Your fingers can point to things. Point to your nose! Your hands are helpers. Let's play with our hands!
learning_objectives: Identify hands and count five fingers

vocabulary_words.definition: Two parts at end of arms with five fingers each
Five long parts on each hand
Hit hands together to make sound
Move hand back and forth to say hello
Use finger to show something
Use hands to lift things

materials_needed: Soft teddy bear or stuffed animal
Large pieces of paper and crayons
content_data.parent_guidance: Count fingers together on both hands. Practice different hand movements. Let child touch different safe textures. Demonstrate gentle hand movements. Celebrate what hands can do.
safety_notes: Use only safe, large objects for handling
No sharp edges or small parts
Wash hands before and after activities
discussion_questions: How many fingers on one hand?
What can your hands do?
Can you clap your hands?

extension_activities.title: Hand Print Art
extension_activities.description: Make hand prints on paper with safe paint or ink pad.

extension_activities.title: Texture Touch Game
extension_activities.description: Touch different safe textures with hands (soft, bumpy, smooth).

content_data.title: Wonderful Feet and Toes
content_data.content: Look down at your feet! You have TWO feet. Each foot has FIVE toes. Count them: one, two, three, four, five! Your feet help you walk. Step step step! Your feet help you run. Your feet help you jump. Jump jump jump! Your feet help you dance. Dance dance dance! Your toes help you balance. Stand on your toes! Your feet take you everywhere. To the kitchen, to your bed, to play outside! Let's move with our feet!
learning_objectives: Identify feet and count five toes
Learn what feet help us do

vocabulary_words.definition: Two parts at end of legs that help you walk
Five small parts on each foot
Move step by step with your feet
Move fast with your feet
Push up with feet and land down
Move feet to music
Stand steady without falling

content_data.parent_guidance: Count toes together on both feet. Practice movements in safe space. Hold child's hand for balance if needed. Keep movements gentle and fun. Ensure safe surface for activities.
safety_notes: Hold child's hand for balance activities
discussion_questions: How many toes on each foot?
What do your feet help you do?
Can you walk on your toes?

extension_activities.title: Toe Wiggle Game
extension_activities.description: Wiggle toes one at a time, then all together.

extension_activities.title: Foot Movement Dance
extension_activities.description: Dance using different foot movements: stepping, marching, tiptoeing.

content_data.title: Can You Find Your Body Parts?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun body parts game! I will ask you to find different parts of your body. Use your hands to gently touch each part when I say it!

vocabulary_words.definition: Look for and point to something
Gently put your hand on something

content_data.parent_guidance: Give child time to find each body part. Demonstrate if needed. Make it fun and encouraging. Celebrate each correct answer. Help guide their hands gently if needed.
discussion_questions: Can you touch your head?
Where are your two eyes?
Show me your nose in the middle of your face.
Open your mouth and show your teeth.
Clap your hands together!
Wiggle all five fingers on one hand.
Stomp your feet on the ground.
Point to your toes.

extension_activities.title: Simon Says Body Parts
extension_activities.description: Play 'Simon says touch your nose' with different body parts.

extension_activities.title: Body Parts Song
extension_activities.description: Sing a song naming each body part while touching it.

content_data.title: Celebrating My Wonderful Body
content_data.content: Your body is amazing! Let's celebrate all the wonderful things your body can do. Your head thinks great thoughts. Your eyes see beautiful colors. Your nose smells lovely flowers. Your mouth says kind words and smiles. Your hands give warm hugs. Your feet take you on adventures. Let's do a body celebration dance! Touch your head and think happy thoughts. Blink your eyes and see something pretty. Breathe through your nose. Smile with your mouth. Clap your hands with joy. Dance with your feet! You have a wonderful, amazing body that helps you every single day!
learning_objectives: Review all body parts and their functions

vocabulary_words.definition: Very special and wonderful
Be happy about something special
Really great and fantastic
Fun journey to explore
Very happy feeling

content_data.parent_guidance: Join in the celebration enthusiastically! Move through each body part together. Make it feel special and positive. Celebrate child's body awareness. Take photos if desired to remember this learning milestone.
safety_notes: Take breaks if child gets tired
discussion_questions: What is your favorite thing your body can do?
Which body part helps you see?
How does your body help you every day?

extension_activities.title: Body Parts Drawing
extension_activities.description: Draw a simple picture of themselves showing head, eyes, nose, mouth, hands, feet.

extension_activities.title: Thank You Body
extension_activities.description: Say 'thank you' to each body part for helping them.
